column4: you might be able to get away with adding your physical hard drive as a device in vmware, then run your ubuntu installation in the vm
all sorts of weird things can happen though
there's also a project called andlinux that lets you run a linux distro on windows with a special kernel that windows can run, but it's buggy
buggy or not, i'm desperate for solutions
well you could give it a try, it can't hurt :)
www.andlinux.org, but if you want to discuss that, try #andlinux or so, this isn't the channel for it
